definition: collective karma (Buddhism)/consequences that all must suffer
common/general/to share/together/total/altogether/abbr. for 共產黨|共产党[Gong4 chan3 dang3], Communist party
line of business/industry/occupation/job/employment/school studies/enterprise/property/(Buddhism) karma/deed/to engage in/already

sentences.english: Even now we are collecting Karma together for the future.
sentences.chinese: 我们现在正在造作的共业，亦会于将来成熟。

sentences.english: The culture, is the sharable and valuable property released from human brains.
sentences.chinese: 文化者，人类心能所开释出来之有价值的共业也。

sentences.english: With collective karma, when disaster occurs, the result will be devastating.
sentences.chinese: 众生共业，灾难若发生，真的就不可收拾了。

sentences.english: Natural and man-made disasters originate in the collective karma.
sentences.chinese: 天灾人祸是共业所感召。

definition: karmic hindrance (buddhism)/karmic consequences that stand in the way of enlightenment/(term of abuse, especially toward the younger generation) devil spawn/(fig.) money
chance/opportunity/predestined relationship/(Buddhist) principal and secondary causes/chain of cause and effect
actual situation/the ultimate essence of things (Buddhism)
to abandon suffering and obtain happiness (Buddhism)
